entries: You gain one additional Eldritch Invocation.
At the end of a long rest, you can choose to change one of your Invocations for another that you meet the requirements for.

optionalfeature.name: Minor Intercession
entries: As an action, you can ask your patron for a small boon.
Roll a Charisma ability check vs your spell save DC. On a success, you grab your patron's attention.

The patron ultimately chooses whether or not it intervenes, or if it will punish you for contacting it, depending on your standing with it or if you can persuade it.  Pestering your patron can have poor consequences.
You patron decides how to intervene. It will only intervene in a minor manner, and if it decides to cast a spell in this way, it will not exceed 5th level.
If your patron intervenes, for better or worse, you can't use this feature again for 7 days.
Otherwise, you can use it again after you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Outwordly Knowledge
entries: You ask your patron for knowledge, and they answer in kind.
Once per long rest, as an action, you may ask your patron about a course of action, as if casting the spell Augury.
Your patron answers to the best of its abilities, but its concept of good or bad outcome (weal or woe) comes from its perspective.

optionalfeature.name: Supernatural Gate
entries: You create a portal to your patron's realm.

As a bonus action, choose an unoccupied 5x5ft space within 60 feet of you. A portal appears at that location, from which otherwordly entities can be seen (such as fey or fiends), but not interacted with.

The Gate is a magical object and occupies its space. It has 18 AC and hitpoints equal to three times your warlock level. As long as the Gate remains, any warlock spell you cast can be done using the gate as its point of origin. For example, a fiend's hand could be seen reaching out of the Gate and casting a Firebolt before disappearing inside it.
As a bonus action on your turn, you may change the gate's position up to 30ft, disappearing and reappearing on its new location.
While the Gate is open, you can take a bonus action on your turn to disintegrate your material body and reappear coming out of your Gate, unharmed. After using this action, the Gate closes.

No creature can pass through the Gate, nor can it be used to contact your Patron directly. The Gate lasts for 1 minute or until you close it (no action required). The Gate also closes if it is ever more than 90 ft away from you or if its hit points are reduced to 0.
Una vez que utilices esta función, no podrás volver a usarla hasta que termines un descanso largo.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Feature
entries: Puedes elegir aprender una Hazaña de la lista de Hazañas Intermedias o Menores. Esta hazaña es una Hazaña de Clase para ti, y no puedes tomar otra Hazaña Intermedia o Menor a través de las Pasivas de Clase incluso si tienes la opción más tarde (como con el multiclase).

optionalfeature.name: Battle Mage
entries: You acquire a limited martial knowledge.
You become proficient with Light Armor and one of the following:
• One martial weapon and shields
• One fighting style of your choice from the Fighter list.

optionalfeature.name: Fractured Mind
entries: You gain the ability to hold concentration on two spells at once.

When you do so, you must roll a Constitution Saving throw at the end of each of your turns to mantain your concentration for the next round. The DC for the check is 10, and increases by 5 on each subsequent round.
All other Constitution Saving throws to mantain concentration are made at disadvantage while concentrating on two spells.

optionalfeature.name: Overloaded Spell
entries: You learn how to burn through your mind to deliver a mighty spell.

Whenever you cast a leveled spell that deals damage, you may choose to spend an additional spell slot of the same level used in the casting to Overload it. When you do so, the spell ignores resistances to its damage type and treats immunity as resistance.
Puedes utilizar esta característica un número de veces igual a tu bonificación de competencia por descanso largo.

optionalfeature.name: Palm Casting
entries: You learn how to deliver your spells at the end of an open palm unarmed strike. You gain the following benefits:

When you cast a spell that requires a ranged spell attack, you can make a melee spell attack instead. Also, if a spell requires a melee attack as part of its casting, it can be performed using your palm instead of a weapon, unless the weapon would be consumed in its casting.

Immediately before you cast a spell that targets or includes a creature within 5ft of you, you can choose to make an unarmed strike against that creature as part of the same action. If that creature is affected by the spell, it also takes damage equal to your unarmed damage, along with any effects caused by the spell. This damage can only be dealt once per spell.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Wit
entries: Your mind is quick and your decisions instant.

As a reaction upon seeing a spell being cast, or as part of a reaction you take immediately after (such as by using Counterspell or Shield) you can make an Intelligence ability check to try to understand what is being cast.
If the roll is a 15 or more, you learn which spell it is.
If the roll is a 20 or more, you also learn the exact level with which it was cast.
You gain advantage on this roll if it is a spell on the wizard list, and you automatically succeed if you know it.

Additionally, you can make any Intelligence based check on your turn as a bonus action rather than an action. You can use these checks to try to learn or recall information on your enemies at the DM's discretion.

optionalfeature.name: Savant
entries: You are a studious person and have spent hours in front of books, gaining benefits according to your Intelligence Score:
• 14 - You can read and write twice as fast, and reading or writing can be done as a bonus action.
• 16 - You become proficient with one tool or instrument of your choice
• 18 - You learn two languages of your choice.
• 20 - Your Maximum number of prepared spells increases by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Spell Echo
entries: When you have a Familiar summoned, whenever you cast a cantrip, you can use your bonus action to reverberate the spell through your familiar. Doing so makes another cast of the cantrip from the familiar's position, and it is cast at its lowest level.

Additionally, when you have a Familiar summoned and you cast a spell of 5th level or lower, immediately after you cast it, you may choose to use a bonus action and sacrifice your familiar to turn it into an echo of your spell.

When you do this, you spend another spell slot of the same level and the spell is cast again from the familiar's position, towards a target of your choice (if applicable). The Familiar dies in the process, and you can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Extract Knowledge
entries: As a bonus action, you present your patron's symbol to a creature to try and pry into their thoughts.

The creature has to make a Wisdom Saving Throw against your spell save DC as if it was the target of a Detect Thoughts spell. On a failed save, your patron (and not you) delves deep into the creature's mind.
Your patron determines whether or not it finds this information valuable. It may reward you for your information, or punish you for wasting its time.

optionalfeature.name: BONK
entries: When you hit an enemy with an attack that deals bludgeoning damage, you can spend a Superiority die to bonk them over the head.
Add your Superiority die roll to the damage dealt and the enemy must make a Constitution Saving Throw versus your Maneuver save DC. On a failure, they are stunned until the end of their next turn.

optionalfeature.name: GROWL
entries: When you start raging, as part of the same bonus action, you can spend a Superiority die to growl and intimidate your enemies.

A number of creatures equal to the number rolled on the die within 30ft of you that can see or hear you must make a Wisdom Saving Throw versus your Maneuver save DC or become frightened until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: HURL
entries: While raging, as an action, or in place of one of your attacks, you can spend a Superiority die to attempt to hurl an enemy grappled by you.

The enemy must make a Strength Saving Throw versus your Maneuver save DC. On a failure you can throw the creature a number of feet equal to your Strength Score, and they take bludgeoning damage equal to your Superiority die roll upon landing.

To perform this action, the enemy must be your size or smaller. If they are at most one size larger than you, you can still attempt to throw them, but they have advantage on the save, and are thrown half the distance.

optionalfeature.name: MAIM
entries: When you hit an enemy with an attack that deals slashing damage, you can spend a Superiority die to maim them.

Add your Superiority die roll to the damage dealt and the enemy must make a Constitution Saving Throw versus your Maneuver save DC. On a failure, they are maimed by you until the start of your next turn.
A maimed creature, on their turn, can either move, take an action or a bonus action, not both.

optionalfeature.name: RESIST
entries: When you are forced to make a saving throw against an illusion or enchantment school spell or effect, you can use your reaction and spend a Superiority die to hit yourself with an unarmed strike.
You then roll the Superiority die and add it to the save, potentially changing the outcome.

optionalfeature.name: STAB
entries: When you hit an enemy with an attack that deals piercing damage, you can spend a Superiority die to split open their defenses.

Add your Superiority die roll to the damage dealt and the enemy must make a Constitution Saving Throw versus your Maneuver save DC. On a failure, they have a -2 penalty to their AC until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: STOMP
entries: When you successfully prone a creature within 5ft of you, you can spend a Superiority die to also stomp them in place.

As part of the same action to prone the creature, it must make a Strength Saving Throw versus your Maneuver save DC. On a failure, they are stomped under your foot and count as being grappled. The enemy takes bludgeoning damage equals your Superiority die roll.
This grapple does not require any free hands to perform, but you can't drag the creature with your movement. The grapple automatically ends if you move more than 5ft away from the creature.

optionalfeature.name: THINK
entries: When you make a Wisdom (Survival), a Wisdom (Animal Handling), or a Intelligence (Nature) check, you can expend one Superiority die and add it to the ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Deflect Blows
entries: As a reaction when an enemy hits you with a melee attack, spend your Superiority die to try to deflect the attack. When you do so, roll your Superiority die and add it to your AC, potentially causing the attack to miss you.

optionalfeature.name: Disrupt Ki
entries: When you hit an enemy with a melee attack, you can spend your Superiority die to disrupt its figthting ability.

They must make a Constitution Saving Throw versus your Maneuver save DC or, until the start of your next turn, the enemy can't take the Attack action. Creatures immune to being stunned can't be affected by this effect.

optionalfeature.name: Disrupt Mana
entries: When you hit an enemy with a melee attack, you can spend your Superiority die to disrupt its spellcasting ability.

They must make a Constitution Saving Throw versus your Maneuver save DC or, until the start of your next turn, the enemy can't take the Cast a Spell action. Creatures immune to being stunned can't be affected by this effect.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Ki
entries: When you hit an enemy with a weapon attack, you may spend your Superiority die and add it to the damage. Additionally, all damage from your attacks until the end of your turn is converted to either acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Grasp of Stone
entries: When you hit a creature with an unarmed attack, you can expend your Superiority die to catch the creature in your crushing grip.
Roll a grapple contested check against your enemy. When you do so, you may use your Dexterity or Strength (your choice) and add your Superiority die to your roll.

optionalfeature.name: Heart Stopper
entries: When you hit a creature with an unarmed attack, you can expend a use of your Superiority die to disrupt its life force.

Add your Superiority die to the damage dealt. The creature must then make a Constitution Saving Throw versus your Maneuver save DC or be knocked unconscious until the start of your next turn, until the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake.

optionalfeature.name: Koshi Guruma
entries: As a reaction when an enemy no more than one size larger than you misses you with a melee attack, you can immediately make a shove contested check against it.
When you do so, you may use your Dexterity (Acrobatics) or Strength (Athletics) for the roll (your choice) and add your Superiority die to it. On a success, you knock the creature prone.

optionalfeature.name: Ude Osae
entries: As a reaction when an enemy no more than one size larger than you misses you with a melee attack, you can immediately make a shove contested check against it.

When you do so, you may use your Dexterity (Acrobatics) or Strength (Athletics) for the roll (your choice) and add your Superiority die to it. On a success, you shove your enemy 10 ft away from you on any direction you choose.

optionalfeature.name: Blasted Away
entries: When you hit an enemy no more than one size Larger than you with your Divine Smite feature, you can spend a Superiority die and blast the enemy away. It must make a Strength Saving Throw or be pushed by a number of feet equal to the damage dealt by your Divine Smite + your Superiority die roll.

optionalfeature.name: Charismatic Presence
entries: When you make a Charisma (Intimidation), or a Charisma (Persuasion) check, you can expend one Superiority die and add it to the ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Guided Precision
entries: When an ally within reach of any of your auras misses with an attack roll, you can use your reaction and roll your Superiority die. You then add it your ally's attack roll, potentially changing the outcome.

optionalfeature.name: Protect
entries: As a bonus action, you can protect an ally within 5ft of you.
Roll your Superiority die and add it to your ally's AC until the start of your next turn or until they leave your side.

optionalfeature.name: Raise Morale
entries: When you use your Lay on Hands feature, you can expend one Superiority die to bolster the resolve of one of your companions.
When you do so, that creature gains temporary hit points equal to the Superiority die roll + your Charisma modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Saviour
entries: When an ally within reach of any of your auras fails a saving throw or ability check, you can use your reaction and roll your Superiority die. You then add it to your ally's save, potentially changing the outcome.

optionalfeature.name: Smitten
entries: When you hit an enemy with your Divine Smite feature, you can spend a Superiority die and force the enemy to make a Charisma Saving throw or lose the will to fight.
On a failure, they must subtract the number rolled on your die from the next attack, ability check or saving throw they make until the end of their next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Uncanny Observation
entries: When you make a Wisdom (Insight), a Wisdom (Perception) check, or a Intelligence (Investigation) check, you can expend one Superiority die and add it to the ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Double Footed Dropkick
entries: When you hit an enemy with an unarmed strike, you can turn it into a drop kick.
You spend a Superiority die and the enemy must make a Strength saving throw versus your Maneuver save DC. On a failure, they're pushed up to 15 ft away and fall prone.
If your unarmed attack was made immediately after you moved at least 15ft in a straight line, the enemy has disadvantage on this save and take additional 1d6 bludgeoning damage if they hit an object.
Whether the enemy saves or fails, you fall prone at the end of this action.

optionalfeature.name: Gut Punch
entries: You aim for the enemy's vitals to weaken it. When you hit a creature with an melee attack, you can force it to make a Constitution Saving Throw against your Maneuver save DC. If it fails, every attack roll against the creature adds your Superiority die until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: I Grab, You Hit
entries: You grab an enemy to give an ally an opening. When you perform a grapple against an enemy, roll your Superiority die and add it to your Athletics check. If you succeed, an ally of yours within 5ft of your enemy can use its reaction to make a melee attack against it.

optionalfeature.name: Melankomas Style
entries: When you take the Brace-Up or Dodge actions, you may spend a Superiority die and roll it. The number rolled on the die is added to your AC until the start of your next turn. This effect does not stack.

optionalfeature.name: Nose For Bullsh-
entries: When you make a Insight or Perception check against a creature's Deception, Sleight of Hand or Intimidation check, you may roll a Superiority die and add the result to the total.

optionalfeature.name: Not My First Tavern Brawl
entries: When you are hit by a melee attack or a ranged attack within 20 ft, you may use your reaction and spend a Superiority die to make an improvised attack using an object you have nearby. You may draw this object as part of the same reaction.
If you hit, roll the Superiority die and add the number rolled to the damage dealt.

optionalfeature.name: Nutcracker
entries: You aim for the enemy's weakest spot. When you hit a creature with an melee attack, add your Superiority die to your damage. It must make a Constitution Saving Throw. On a failure, its movement for its next turn is 0.

optionalfeature.name: 'Oh Sh-' Moment
entries: When you roll for initiative, you may spend one Superiority die and a Moxie point to immediately gain the benefits of a Brace-Up (minimum equals your Constitution modifier) and add the number rolled to the temporary hit points gained.

optionalfeature.name: Tag Team
entries: When you take the Attack action against an enemy, you can choose to expend one of your Superiority dice and forego one of your attacks to call out an ally you can see to help you. They can spend their reaction to either move up to their movement towards your enemy or make an attack if it is in range. If the attack hits, your ally adds your Superiority die to its damage.

optionalfeature.name: Threaten and Showboat
entries: When you hit an enemy with a melee attack, you may spend up to three Superiority dice and add the dice spent to your damage roll. You then choose to either threaten or infuriate your target.
When you do so, the enemy must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Maneuver save DC. If it fails they're threatened or infuriated by you.
{@b Threaten.} If you successfully threaten the enemy, it has disadvantage  on attack rolls and ability checks against you for a number of turns equal to the number of dice spent on the roll.

{@b Showboat.} If you successfully infuriate your enemy, they have disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks against anyone other than you for a number of turns equal to the number of dice spent on the roll.
Creatures that are immune to the frightened condition are immune to Threaten, and creatures immune to the charmed condition are immune to Showboat.

optionalfeature.name: Uppercut
entries: When you hit a creature with an unarmed attack, you can expend one Superiority die to attempt to knock the target down. You add the Superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and if the target is at most one size larger than you, it must make a Strength saving throw against your Maneuver save DC.
On a failed save, your target is thrown up a number of feet equal to half your Strength score and the target is knocked prone. If it is larger than you, it doesn't get thrown up.

optionalfeature.name: Back Off
entries: When you hit a creature with an unarmed attack, you can expend one Superiority die to attempt to knock the target down. You add the Superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and if the target is at most one size larger than you, it must make a Strength saving throw against your Maneuver save DC.
On a failed save, your target is thrown up a number of feet equal to half your Strength score and the target is knocked prone. If it is larger than you, it doesn't get thrown up.

optionalfeature.name: Dynamism
entries: When you make an initiative roll, you can expend one Superiority die and add the die to the roll, provided you aren't incapacitated. When you do so, on your first turn of combat, you gain twice the amount rolled as additional walking speed.

optionalfeature.name: Intimidating Blow
entries: When you critically hit an enemy or reduce it to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to force an enemy you can see within 30ft to make a Wisdom Saving throw. On a failure, the enemy is Frightened and takes psychic damage equal to twice your Superiority die roll.

optionalfeature.name: Mark Weakness
entries: When you mark an enemy with your Hunter's Mark or Favored foe, or as a bonus action against an enemy, you can spend a Superiority die and reduce the enemy's AC by the same amount. This effect lasts until it is hit by an attack roll or until the end of the creature's next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Natural Instinct
entries: When you make an Intelligence (Investigation), a Wisdom (Perception) check, or a Wisdom (Survival) check, you can expend one Superiority die and add it to the ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Superior Conditioning
entries: When you make a Strength (Athletics) or a Dexterity (Acrobatics) check, you may roll a Superiority die or add it to the check.
When you make a long jump, you may roll a Superiority die and add three times the number rolled to the total distance covered.

optionalfeature.name: Trooper
entries: When you make a Constitution or Wisdom Saving Throw and fail, you may spend a Superiority die and add it to your save, potentially changing the outcome.

optionalfeature.name: Overwatch
entries: When a Favored Enemy of yours, or an enemy marked by you (Hunter's Mark or Favored Foe) hits an ally you can see with an attack, you can use your reaction to make a weapon attack against it, provided it is within the range of your weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Coup de Grace
entries: Before you make an attack, you can declare it to be a Coup de Grace. If you do so, roll your Superiority die.
The number rolled is subtracted from your attack roll, but you also reduce the threshold for a critical strike by the same number.
(For instance, if you roll a 3, and you would crit at 20, your attack roll will have a -3 penalty to hit, but will crit at 17 or above).

optionalfeature.name: Deadeye Strike
entries: Before you make a weapon attack roll against a creature with a weapon you are proficient with, you can expend one Superiority die to attack with careful precision at the expense of damage.
For this attack only, you strike as if you had expertise in your weapon. If it hits, subtract the number rolled on the Superiority die from your damage.

optionalfeature.name: Deadly Finish
entries: When you reduce an enemy to 0 hit points, you can attempt to Intimidate nearby enemies.

Make a Charisma (Intimidation) check and roll your Superiority die. A number of enemies of your choice within 30 ft equal to the number rolled must make a Wisdom (Insight) versus your Intimidation, on a failure they're frightened until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Fan of Knives
entries: When you take the Attack action while wielding two thrown weapons, you can exchange an attack and spend one Superiority die to instantly throw both weapons towards any valid targets you can see within range.
On a hit, you add the Superiority die roll to your damage.

optionalfeature.name: Ghostwalk
entries: When you take the Hide action, you can spend a Superiority die and add it to your roll.

optionalfeature.name: Mine!
entries: When creature misses you with a weapon attack, you can expend one Superiority die to attempt to steal the target's weapon.

Make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) contested by the enemy's Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics). On a success, you disarm the enemy and grab the weapon it is holding, provided you have a free hand. Otherwise, the weapon falls on the ground.
A creature holding its weapon with both hands has advantage on the check.

optionalfeature.name: Slyness
entries: When you make a Charisma (Deception) or a Charisma (Persuasion) check, you can expend one Superiority die and add it to the ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Unpinnable
entries: Whenever you fail a Saving throw or ability check against an effect that would cause you to be grappled, shoved, pushed, proned or restrained, you can use your reaction to spend a Superiority die and add it to the save or check. You can perform this after you see the roll, but before the effect applies.

optionalfeature.name: Bear Hugger
entries: When you successfully grapple a target, you may deal damage equals to your {@italic Fisticuffs die} (minimum of a d6) + your Strength modifier. After a successfull grapple, as an action, or in place of one of your attacks, you may try to constrict your target. The enemy must make a Strength saving throw versus 8 + your proficiency + your Strength modifier, on a failure they take the same damage again.

optionalfeature.name: Raging Bull
entries: When you take the Dash action, your next melee attack this turn deals extra damage equals to your {@italic Fisticuffs die} (minimum of a d6).
Además, si golpeas este ataque, y habías gastado un punto de Moxie o Ki para Dash (como con {@italic Stick and Move} o {@italic Step of the Wind}), recuperas tu punto gastado.

optionalfeature.name: Stuntmaster
entries: You learn two maneuvers of your choice from among those available in the Pugilist list.

Ganas un dado de superioridad, que es un d6 (este dado se añade a cualquier dado de superioridad que tengas de otra fuente). Este dado se utiliza para alimentar tus maniobras. Un dado de superioridad se gasta cuando lo utilizas. Recuperas los dados gastados cuando terminas un descanso corto o largo.

optionalfeature.name: Thrashing Gorilla
entries: When you shove a creature back you can push them 5ft multiplied by your Strength modifier. Additionally, when you successfuly shove a creature against something (or someone else) or if you shove it prone, you may deal damage equal to your {@italic Fisticuffs die} (minimum of a d6) + your Strength modifier to it.

optionalfeature.name: Tyson Step
entries: The first 10ft of movement you spend after making an unarmed attack against a creature does not provoke opportunity attacks.
Puedes tomar esta Pasiva varias veces, obteniendo un estilo diferente cada vez. No puedes tomar el mismo estilo dos veces, independientemente de la fuente.

feat.name: Brawling Initiate
entries: Your experience in brawls has helped you develop a particular style of fighting. As a result, you learn one Fighting Style option of your choice from the pugilist class. If you already have a style, the one you choose must be different.
Whenever you reach a level that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace this feat's scrap style with another one from the pugilist class that you don't have.

feat.name: Inner Peace
entries: You've managed to unlock your spirit's inner ki, granting you the following:
You can use a d4 + Dexterity modifier for unarmed attacks you make
You gain two Ki points, which are added to any Ki you might have. You regain any spent Ki on a short rest.
You learn one of the following abilities, which are fueled by your Ki:
{@b Flurry of Blows}
Immediately after you take the Attack action on your turn, you can spend 1 ki point to make two unarmed strikes as a bonus action.
{@b Patient Defense}
You can spend 1 ki point to take the Dodge action as a bonus action on your turn.
{@b Step of the Wind}
You can spend 1 ki point to take the Disengage or Dash action as a bonus action on your turn, and your jump distance is doubled for the turn.

feat.name: Martial Adept (Variant)
entries: You have martial training that allows you to perform special combat maneuvers. You gain the following benefits:
Choose one class between the following: Barbarian, Fighter, Monk, Paladin, Pugilist, Ranger, Rogue. You learn two maneuvers of your choice from among those available to that class.

If a maneuver you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

You gain one superiority die, which is a d6 (this die is added to any superiority dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your maneuvers. A superiority die is expended when you use it.
You regain your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Pugilist at Heart
entries: You've learned some of a pugilist's scrappiness:
You can use a d6 + Strength modifier for unarmed attacks and improvised weapon attacks you make.
You gain two Moxie points, which are added to any Moxie you might have. You regain any spent Moxie on a short rest.
You learn one of the following abilities, which are fueled by your Moxie:
{@b Brace Up}

You can use a bonus action and spend 1 moxie point to brace for attacks. Roll your fisticuffs die (or a d6) + your pugilist level (or your proficiency modifier) + your Constitution modifier and gain that many temporary hit points.
{@b The Old One-Two}
Immediately after you take the Attack action on your turn, you can spend 1 moxie point to make two unarmed strikes as a bonus action.
{@b Stick and Move}
You can use a bonus action and expend 1 moxie point to make a shove attack or the Dash action.
